content: knit little sea creatures designed by lorraine pistorio i hope you enjoy creating your own little sea creature stitch explanation k knit p purl m1 = make one pick up the bar between the stitches from front to back use the right needle to knit this bar through the back loop… 1 stitch increased a lifted increase could be substituted for the m1 k2tog = knit 2 stitches together… 1 stitch decreased ssk = slip 1 stitch knit-wise slip 1 stitch purl- wise slip left needle into front of these two stitches and knit them together… 1 stitch decreased notes this pattern is knit in the round using the magic loop method on a long circular needle if you are unfamiliar with the magic loop method there are many youtube videos on magic loop you may materials wish to view double pointed needles could be #4-worsted wt aran/10-ply yarn approx yards substituted octopus 50 yds octopus starfish 35 yds beginning the tentacles… make 8 turtle color a 25 yds color b 15 yds leaving long tail cast on 12 sts crab 40 yds and join in-the-round… small amt yarn for eyes mouth size 4 3 5mm 32 circular knitting needles if rounds 1-11 k using magic loop or double pointed needles do not bind off cut yarn leaving long tail large-eyed blunt needle sewing needle this tail will be used later to close the openings between removable stitch markers ring markers the tentacles stuff tentacle…now at the cast-on polyester fiberfill stuffing long straight pins edge thread yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt needle insert needle through the outer loops of the 12 cast- skill level intermediate on stitches and pull up to gather and secure size approx height…octopus 3 ½ turtle 2 ½ place the first starfish 2 crab 1 ½ 6 stitches the resulting size will be determined by the type onto a yarn of yarn size needles and your personal gauge holder a gauge gauge is not critical for this project work tight place the last enough to ensure that the stuffing will not show 6 stitches through the stitches onto a different
